citation.article-title: Characterization of filamentous Eikelboom type 021N bacteria and description of Thiothrix disciformis sp. nov. and Thiothrix flexilis sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Thiothrix (Winogradsky 1888) Howarth et al. 1999

The formal description remains that given by Howarth et al. (1999), with the following modifications to cell size and gonidium production. Cells are 0.7-4.0 μm in diameter and 0.7-5.5 μm in length; gliding gonidia are produced from the end of the filaments in some but not all strains.
